Key Match Events: Jacob Stallings' RBI double in the ninth helped the Colorado Rockies beat the Detroit Tigers 4-2
Brendan Rodgers led off the ninth with a single
Nolan Jones moved to third on a groundout
Jake Cave made it 4-2 with a long sacrifice fly
Post-Match Reflections: Jacob Stallings: 'This is the end of an 11-day road trip and all nine games were against teams in the playoffs or fighting for wild-card spots and we held our own'
Bud Black: 'That's a really, really good win on the road against a team that has been rolling since August'
A.J. Hinch: 'We didn't get untracked at all, and a lot of that came from (Ryan) Feltner being really good'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tarik Skubal began the day three games behind the Minnesota Twins for the third American League wild-card spot
Skubal pitched six innings, giving up one run on four hits
The Rockies took a 1-0 lead on Jordan Beckâ€™s third-inning homer
Spencer Torkelson put the Tigers ahead with a two-run double in the fourth
Ezequiel Tovar nearly put the Rockies ahead in the fifth, but Riley Greene made a leaping catch at the wall to take away a two-run home run
Charlie Blackmon tied the game with a pinch-hit infield single off Sean Guenther in the seventh
Others: Tyler Kinley pitched the ninth inning, retiring Zach McKinstry with runners at the corners for his 12th save
The next hitter, Ryan McMahon, hit a bouncer back to the mound. Skubal made the play without apparent difficulty, but left after the inning
Hinch said X-rays were negative but Skubal would have more tests on the hand
Seth Halvorsen (1-0) picked up his first major-league win with a scoreless eighth
The Tigers didn't get a hit after Torkelson's RBI double until he singled with two out in the ninth
